definitions.definition: being the first one after the present one or after the one just mentioned:
examples: Who works in the office next to yours?

definitions.definition: The time when you next do something is the first time you do it again:
examples: [ + -ing verb ] When are you next going to Toronto?

definitions.definition: used when describing two people or things that are very close to each other with nothing between them:
examples: Can I sit next to the window?

definitions.definition: used to mean `after' when making a choice or a comparison:
examples: Cheese is my favourite food and, next to that, chocolate. (= Cheese is the only food that I like more than chocolate.)
They pay me next to nothing (= very little) but I really enjoy the work.

definitions.definition: next in order to appear or happen, often in some form of entertainment:
examples: Next up is the latest news from the presidential campaign .
